**DigitalT3 – AI-Enabled Learning Management System (LMS)**

DigitalT3 is an AI software services and consulting firm. This Learning Management System (LMS) is a strategic internal platform designed to embed training, evaluation, and readiness scoring into DigitalT3’s delivery lifecycle. The platform leverages AI to enhance learning, automate evaluation, and provide actionable insights for talent development and project readiness. It is built to be secure, scalable, GDPR-ready, and cloud-native, aligning with modern enterprise requirements.

React is selected as the most suitable framework because create-react-app and common React toolchain components (typescript, webpack, jest, eslint, yarn/npm) are present, React is widely used for complex enterprise SPAs, and it aligns with the frontend container role. The platform type is 'web' because this is a browser-based frontend application (SPA/PWA) for the LMS.

Minimal package.json with React and react-dom (and optionally typescript and @types/react if using TypeScript)
Create React App or a minimal webpack/parcel build setup (use create-react-app for absolute minimal scaffolding)

ESLint and Prettier for basic linting (optional but minimal dev tooling)
Environment variables support via dotenv for headless configuration
A simple static assets folder and a minimal public/index.html
CI-friendly npm scripts: install, build, start (start should run the dev server or serve built static files with a lightweight static server like serve)
Avoid including heavy production servers (nginx), databases, or enterprise monitoring in the frontend container

steps.name: environment
steps.description: Validate Node (>=18), npm and yarn availability; print exact versions and remediation guidance. Persist minimal environment to /etc/profile.d/webappfrontend_node.sh safely: export NODE_ENV=development and add quoted npm global bin only if it exists and isn't already present (checked using colon-delimited PATH membership). Use atomic write with sudo tee. Do not modify caller PATH inline; ensure profile script is POSIX-safe and robust to special characters.
steps.script_code:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
WORKSPACE="/home/kavia/workspace/code-generation/lms_dt3-307785-309184/WebAppFrontend"
# verify runtime tools and print versions with guidance
command -v node >/dev/null 2>&1 || { echo "ERROR: node not found. Install Node.js v18+" >&2; exit 2; }
NODE_V=$(node -v 2>/dev/null || echo "")
command -v npm >/dev/null 2>&1 || { echo "ERROR: npm not found. Install npm (bundled with Node.js)" >&2; exit 3; }
NPM_V=$(npm -v 2>/dev/null || echo "")
YARN_V=""
if command -v yarn >/dev/null 2>&1; then YARN_V=$(yarn -v 2>/dev/null || echo ""); fi
# Check Node major
NODE_MAJOR=${NODE_V#v}
NODE_MAJOR=${NODE_MAJOR%%.*}
if ! [[ "$NODE_MAJOR" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then echo "ERROR: Unable to parse node version: $NODE_V" >&2; exit 4; fi
if [ "$NODE_MAJOR" -lt 18 ]; then echo "ERROR: Node.js v18+ required; found $NODE_V. Please upgrade Node or use the container with Node v18+." >&2; exit 5; fi
echo "info: node=$NODE_V npm=$NPM_V yarn=${YARN_V:-none}"
# Resolve npm global bin, prefer npm first then yarn global bin
NG_BIN=""
NG_BIN=$(npm bin -g 2>/dev/null || true)
if [ -z "$NG_BIN" ] && command -v yarn >/dev/null 2>&1; then NG_BIN="$(yarn global bin 2>/dev/null || true)"; fi
if [ -z "$NG_BIN" ]; then NG_BIN="/usr/local/bin"; fi
# Write profile snippet atomically; guard and quote NG_BIN using single quotes inside EOF
PROFILE="/etc/profile.d/webappfrontend_node.sh"
TMPFILE=$(mktemp)
cat > "$TMPFILE" <<'PROFILE_EOF'
# WebAppFrontend environment (generated)
export NODE_ENV=development
# prepend npm/yarn global bin if present and not already in PATH (colon-surrounded check)
NG_BIN_PLACEHOLDER
if [ -n "${NG_BIN_VAL}" ]; then
  case ":${PATH}:" in *":${NG_BIN_VAL}:"*) :;; *) export PATH="${NG_BIN_VAL}:${PATH}";; esac
fi
PROFILE_EOF
# insert quoted NG_BIN into placeholder safely (no expansion of other vars)
sed -i "s|NG_BIN_PLACEHOLDER|NG_BIN_VAL='$(printf "%q" "$NG_BIN")'|" "$TMPFILE"
sudo tee "$PROFILE" < "$TMPFILE" >/dev/null && sudo chmod 644 "$PROFILE" && rm -f "$TMPFILE"
# Check create-react-app presence and inform (do not hide diagnostics)
if command -v create-react-app >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "info: create-react-app available"; else echo "info: create-react-app not found; scaffold may use npx if network available"; fi
exit 0

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

WORKSPACE="/home/kavia/workspace/code-generation/lms_dt3-307785-309184/WebAppFrontend"
# Validate node, npm, yarn; print versions and remediation guidance
command -v node >/dev/null 2>&1 || { echo "ERROR: node not found. Install Node.js v18+ (https://nodejs.org/) or load an environment with Node v18+." >&2; exit 2; }
NODE_V=$(node -v 2>/dev/null || echo "")
command -v npm >/dev/null 2>&1 || { echo "ERROR: npm not found. Install npm (bundled with Node.js) or ensure npm is on PATH." >&2; exit 3; }
NPM_V=$(npm -v 2>/dev/null || echo "")
YARN_V=""
if command -v yarn >/dev/null 2>&1; then YARN_V=$(yarn -v 2>/dev/null || echo ""); fi

# Parse Node major version robustly
NODE_MAJOR=${NODE_V#v}
NODE_MAJOR=${NODE_MAJOR%%.*}
if ! printf '%s' "$NODE_MAJOR" | grep -Eq '^[0-9]+$'; then echo "ERROR: Unable to parse node version: $NODE_V" >&2; exit 4; fi
if [ "${NODE_MAJOR}" -lt 18 ]; then echo "ERROR: Node.js v18+ required; found $NODE_V. Please upgrade Node or use a container/image with Node v18+." >&2; exit 5; fi

echo "info: node=$NODE_V npm=$NPM_V yarn=${YARN_V:-none}"

# Resolve npm global bin; prefer npm then yarn; fall back to /usr/local/bin if resolution fails
NG_BIN=""
NG_BIN=$(npm bin -g 2>/dev/null || true)
if [ -z "${NG_BIN:-}" ] && command -v yarn >/dev/null 2>&1; then NG_BIN=$(yarn global bin 2>/dev/null || true); fi
if [ -z "${NG_BIN:-}" ]; then NG_BIN="/usr/local/bin"; fi

# Ensure NG_BIN exists as a directory; if not, do not attempt to insert it
if [ ! -d "${NG_BIN}" ]; then
echo "warning: resolved npm/yarn global bin '${NG_BIN}' does not exist; profile will not add it." >&2
NG_BIN=""
fi

# Prepare POSIX-safe profile snippet and write atomically using sudo tee
PROFILE="/etc/profile.d/webappfrontend_node.sh"
TMPFILE=$(mktemp)
trap 'rm -f "$TMPFILE"' EXIT
cat > "$TMPFILE" <<'PROFILE_EOF'
# WebAppFrontend environment (generated)
# Export NODE_ENV for development shells
export NODE_ENV=development
# If NG_BIN_VAL is set and not already in PATH (checked with colon-surrounded membership), prepend it
if [ -n "${NG_BIN_VAL:-}" ]; then
  case ":${PATH}:" in *":${NG_BIN_VAL}:"*) : ;; *)
    # Prepend the quoted path safely
    export PATH="${NG_BIN_VAL}:${PATH}"
    ;;
  esac
fi
PROFILE_EOF

# Insert the safely quoted NG_BIN into the placeholder variable name NG_BIN_VAL
# Use printf %q to escape special characters, then wrap in single quotes for literal assignment in the heredoc
if [ -n "${NG_BIN:-}" ]; then
  # produce a single-quoted, literal assignment line appended to the temp file before the body
  # We'll prepend the assignment line to the file to ensure NG_BIN_VAL is available to the script body
  ASSIGN_LINE="NG_BIN_VAL='$(printf "%q" "$NG_BIN")'"
  # create a new temp with the assignment first, then the body (to avoid sed complexities)
  TMP2=$(mktemp)
  { printf '%s\n' "$ASSIGN_LINE"; cat "$TMPFILE"; } > "$TMP2"
  mv "$TMP2" "$TMPFILE"
fi

# Atomically write to /etc/profile.d via sudo tee and set permissions
sudo tee "$PROFILE" < "$TMPFILE" >/dev/null
sudo chmod 644 "$PROFILE"

# Clean up temp file (trap will remove if exists)
rm -f "$TMPFILE" || true
trap - EXIT

# Inform about create-react-app availability (do not hide diagnostics)
if command -v create-react-app >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "info: create-react-app available"; else echo "info: create-react-app not found; scaffold may use npx if network available"; fi

exit 0

steps.name: dependencies
steps.description: Install project-local runtime and devDependencies only when missing. Detect package manager via lockfile and use yarn if present. Do NOT reinstall globally-available CLIs. Use conservative semver or known-good pins for reproducibility; skip installing deps already declared in package.json. Clean temporary files and record installed packages in $WORKSPACE/.run/deps-installed.txt.
steps.script_code:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
WORKSPACE="/home/kavia/workspace/code-generation/lms_dt3-307785-309184/WebAppFrontend"
RUN_DIR="$WORKSPACE/.run"
mkdir -p "$RUN_DIR" && cd "$WORKSPACE"
[ -f package.json ] || { echo "ERROR: package.json missing; run scaffold first" >&2; exit 6; }
PM="npm"
[ -f yarn.lock ] && PM="yarn"
# Determine missing runtime deps (check both dependencies and devDependencies)
NEED_RUNTIME=("react@18.2.0" "react-dom@18.2.0" "react-scripts@5.0.1" "dotenv@16.0.0")
TO_INSTALL_RUNTIME=()
node - <<'NODE'
const fs=require('fs');const j=JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('package.json'));const deps=Object.assign({},j.dependencies||{},j.devDependencies||{});const need=['react','react-dom','react-scripts','dotenv'];const out=[];need.forEach(n=>{if(!deps[n]) out.push(n);});console.log(out.join(' '));
NODE
MISSING_RUNTIME=$(node -e "const fs=require('fs');const j=JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('package.json'));const deps=Object.assign({},j.dependencies||{},j.devDependencies||{});const need=['react','react-dom','react-scripts','dotenv'];console.log(need.filter(n=>!deps[n]).map(n=>n+'@' + ({react:'18.2.0', 'react-dom':'18.2.0','react-scripts':'5.0.1','dotenv':'16.0.0'}[n])).join(' '));")
if [ -n "$MISSING_RUNTIME" ]; then
  if [ "$PM" = "yarn" ]; then yarn add --silent $MISSING_RUNTIME; else npm i --no-audit --no-fund --silent $MISSING_RUNTIME --save; fi
fi
# Dev deps: conservative pins/ranges and skip if already present
DEV_CANDIDATES=("serve@^14.0.0" "cross-env@^7.0.0" "@testing-library/react@^14.0.0" "@testing-library/jest-dom@^6.0.0" "eslint@^8.0.0" "prettier@^2.0.0")
# include TS types if tsconfig.json present
if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then DEV_CANDIDATES+=("@types/react@^18.0.0" "@types/react-dom@^18.0.0" "typescript@^5.0.0"); fi
# build list of candidates not already declared
TO_INSTALL_DEV=""
for p in "${DEV_CANDIDATES[@]}"; do
  NAME=$(echo "$p" | sed 's/@.*//')
  node -e "const fs=require('fs');const j=JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('package.json'));const deps=Object.assign({},j.dependencies||{},j.devDependencies||{});if(!deps['$NAME']) process.exit(0); process.exit(1);" || { TO_INSTALL_DEV="$TO_INSTALL_DEV $p"; }
done
if [ -n "$TO_INSTALL_DEV" ]; then
  if [ "$PM" = "yarn" ]; then yarn add --dev --silent $TO_INSTALL_DEV; else npm i --no-audit --no-fund --silent --save-dev $TO_INSTALL_DEV; fi
fi
# record installed deps for operator visibility
npm ls --depth=0 >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
( { echo "runtime_missing:$MISSING_RUNTIME"; echo "dev_installed:$TO_INSTALL_DEV"; } ) > "$RUN_DIR/deps-installed.txt"
exit 0

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
# start CRA dev server headless and persist logs/pids for deterministic discovery
WORKSPACE="/home/kavia/workspace/code-generation/lms_dt3-307785-309184/WebAppFrontend"
cd "$WORKSPACE"
RUN_DIR="$WORKSPACE/.run"; mkdir -p "$RUN_DIR"

PIDFILE="$RUN_DIR/dev-server.pid"

export NODE_ENV=development
export BROWSER=none
PORT="3000"
# choose command: prefer yarn when yarn.lock present
if [ -f "yarn.lock" ]; then CMD=(yarn start); else CMD=(npm start); fi
# ensure no existing listener on port -> fail early with clear message
if command -v ss >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  if ss -ltn "sport = :$PORT" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "ERROR: port $PORT already in use. Aborting start. Check existing process." >&2
    exit 8
  fi
elif command -v netstat >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  if netstat -ltn 2>/dev/null | /bin/grep -q ":$PORT\b"; then
    echo "ERROR: port $PORT already in use. Aborting start. Check existing process." >&2
    exit 8
  fi
fi
# launch in background using nohup + setsid to create independent process group
# redirect stdout/stderr to log; use exec in bash -c to replace shell and have stable PID
nohup bash -c "exec setsid ${CMD[*]}" >"$LOG" 2>&1 &
PID=$!
# persist PID and PGID for deterministic discovery
printf "%s\n" "$PID" >"$PIDFILE"
PGID=$(ps -o pgid= -p "$PID" 2>/dev/null | tr -d ' ' || true)
# if pgid not obtained immediately, try wait loop briefly
if [ -z "$PGID" ]; then
  for _i in 1 2 3; do
    sleep 0.2
    PGID=$(ps -o pgid= -p "$PID" 2>/dev/null | tr -d ' ' || true)
    [ -n "$PGID" ] && break
  done
fi
printf "%s\n" "$PGID" >"$PGFILE"
# wait for port readiness (20s total)
ready=0
for i in {1..20}; do
  if command -v ss >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    ss -ltn "sport = :$PORT" >/dev/null 2>&1 && { ready=1; break; }
  elif command -v netstat >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    netstat -ltn 2>/dev/null | /bin/grep -q ":$PORT\b" && { ready=1; break; }
  fi
  sleep 1
done
# if port not listening, fail and include log path
if [ "$ready" -ne 1 ]; then
  echo "ERROR: dev server did not open port $PORT within timeout. See log: $LOG" >&2
  echo "PID saved in: $PIDFILE" >&2
  exit 7
fi
# if curl available, check for HTTP 2xx/3xx; otherwise just report success
if command -v curl >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  HTTP=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" "http://127.0.0.1:$PORT/" || true)
